title: Simple Tense (pu/ca/ba)
goal: Learn basic tense markers for past, present, and future.

sections.content:
New Material (5-7 min)

Tense Is Optional in Lojban

By default, Lojban sentences are tenseless:

mi klama

I go / I went / I will go — context determines when.

Simple Tense Markers

Cmavo Meaning Example
pu past mi pu klama (I went)
ca present mi ca klama (I am going now)
ba future mi ba klama (I will go)

Placement

Tense goes before the selbri:

mi pu citka

I ate.

do ca gunka

You are working (now).

la .bob. ba klama

Bob will go.

With cu

After complex sumti, use cu:

la barda gerku cu pu bajra

The big dog ran.

Why Use Tense?

Only add tense when time matters:

  • Narrative clarity
  • Contrasting times
  • Answering "when" questions

Key Point

pu = past, ca = present, ba = future. Tense is optional — use when time matters.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Add Tense

Add the appropriate tense marker:

  1. I ate. (past) → ?
  2. I am eating. (present) → ?
  3. I will eat. (future) → ?
Answers
  1. mi pu citka
  2. mi ca citka
  3. mi ba citka

Exercise 2: Translate with Tense

Translate:

  1. Bob went to Paris.
  2. Alice is working.
  3. I will sleep.
Answers
  1. la .bob. cu pu klama la .paris.
  2. la .alis. ca gunka
  3. mi ba sipna

Exercise 3: Narrative Sequence

Translate this story:

  1. I ate.
  2. Now I work.
  3. Later I will sleep.
Answers
  1. mi pu citka
  2. ca mi gunka
  3. mi ba sipna

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I went." → mi pu klama
  2. "I am here now." → mi ca zvati ti
  3. "I will eat." → mi ba citka

Today's Grammar

Cmavo Tense Example
pu past mi pu klama
ca present mi ca klama
ba future mi ba klama

Summary

You learned simple tense: pu (past), ca (present), ba (future). These go before the selbri and are optional.
